availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel A. Spencer (Green County, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Kentucky native. Married to Virginia Willis in Adair County, Kentucky, on January 31, 1828. Father of Louisa H. Spencer, Alice C. Spencer, Ann R. Spencer, Samuel F. Spencer, and Mary B. Spencer. Attorney in Green County in 1860. Presiding Judge of the Green County Court in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 628.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, Film #001904582, p. 162/162 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1863,” in 1864 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 10. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), p. 304.
Find A Grave, "Samuel A. Spencer (1803-1871)," Memorial #73272613, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73272613 (accessed June 15, 2020).
